original: Ekström, Gustav Werner, musikdirektör, organist, Borås, f. 22/11/96 i Sthlm av John Gust. Chr. E. o. Hulda Thorneld. G. 22 m. Ingeborg Johnsson. Barn: Kerstin f. 23, Bengt 27, Margit 32. — Org:ex. 14, musiklär :-o. kyrkosång:ex. 31 v. musikko-ns. Res. t. Tyskl., Ö’Sterr. 20. Ackomp. v. musikkons. 19-26, repetitör i opera-s’k. 20-23, pianist å Skansens Högloft 19-27, kap :mäst. å Skansens frilufts-teat. tre ’s0mm:sä’s. fr. 24, org. o. kör-led. i Gustaf Adolfskyrkan i Borås fr. 28, sånglär. v. h. folksk. fr. 30. Förb :-dirig. i Sjuhär :bygd. körförb. fr. 28. Medl. av Odd Fellow. Mus. akad. jeton f, piano^speln. 17, P. A. Bergs jeton f. orgelspeln. 14.
translated: Ekström, Gustav Werner, music director, organist, Borås, b. November 22, 1896 in Stockholm to John Gust. Chr. E. and Hulda Thorneld. Married in 1922 to Ingeborg Johnsson. Children: Kerstin b. 1923, Bengt b. 1927, Margit b. 1932. Completed organ exam in 1914 and music teacher exam in 1931. Traveled to Germany and Austria in 1920. Accompanist for music concerts from 1919-1926, opera rehearsal pianist from 1920-1923, pianist at Skansen's Högloft from 1919-1927, head conductor at Skansen's outdoor theater from 1924, organ and choir conductor at Gustaf Adolfskyrkan in Borås starting in 1928, singing teacher at h. folksk. starting in 1930. Federation conductor in Sjuhärbygdens choir federation starting in 1928. Member of Odd Fellow. Received Mus. academy jeton for piano playing in 1917 and P. A. Bergs jeton for organ playing in 1914.
